poem:
"Idle Change of Law"
 
Pet's theft, an incongruity in sorrow
abutting that of a television gone.
Ripple of loss versus voiding hollow,
Compare them, no - they poorly share the dawn.
The bill indulgent? Yet, perceive the essence, 
a heart's lament - not economic doubt.
In love, in loss, measure resilience,
For matters of the heart oft carry clout.
